RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Defendants: RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the Border Patrol agents: Jorge Luis Trevino and Marco Montemayor
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the drivers: RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the agents: Jorge Luis Trevino and Marco Montemayor
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the defendants: RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.

Defendant who appeared to dispute Agent Trevino's observation about the vehicle going off the road during his testimony in a hearing
Defendant arrested by Agent Benavides due to sufficient nexus between the two vehicles and knowledge of the load car-scout car pattern, whose motion to suppress was recommended for denial by the Magistrate Judge, testified that he did not feel free to leave even after being handed his citation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRI: Defendants whose vehicles were stopped by law enforcement officers, and who were suspected of being involved in alien smuggling activities
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino: United States Border Patrol Agent who encountered illegal aliens in a white sedan on FM 2050 and radioed for other agents to be on the lookout for a black truck Dodge, testified about road conditions during a hearing
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Rodriguez: Individual involved in the incident, referred to as Ignacio Rodriguez
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Agent Rodriguez: United States Border Patrol Agent who alerted to the two vehicles
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Agent Trevino: United States Border Patrol Agent who testified during cross examination about not knowing the residents of Moglia ranch house or Stag trailer and their owners
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino and Rodriguez: Border Patrol agents involved in the investigation of suspicious vehicles on FM 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mills Bennett: Involved in the case, mentioned during the cross examination of Agent Trevino, associated with a dirt road near the checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Reymundo Reyes: Law enforcement officer who performed the traffic stop on Ignacio Rodriguez's vehicle and issued a citation, testified that it was within his rights to impound the vehicle for lack of proof of insurance
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and Jorge Luis Tr: Individuals involved in the case, with Ignacio Rodriguez as a defendant and Jorge Luis Trevino as a United States Border Patrol Agent
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hugo Benavides: United States Border Patrol Agent who had probable cause to arrest Ignacio Rodriguez upon contact with him
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mr. Rodriguez: Defendant stopped by Officer Reyes, driver of the vehicle, transported to a checkpoint for further questioning
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Agent Benavides: Law enforcement agent who recalled arriving as Officer Reyes was in the process of writing the citation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marco Montemayor: Special Agent for the United States Department of Homeland Security who interviewed Ignacio Rodriguez after he was transported to the checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marco Montemayor and his partner: Agents who interviewed Ignacio Rodriguez after he waived his Miranda rights
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ricardo Rodriguez: Defendant who testified in a hearing about not going off the road
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ignacio Rodriguez: Defendant who suggested that Agent Benavides did not show up until twenty minutes after he already had his ticket
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ: Border Patrol agents involved in the investigation of suspicious vehicles on FM 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hugo Benavides in CHUNK_TEXT: United States Border Patrol Agent who questioned Defendant at the Border Patrol station and did not corroborate Agent Trevino's testimony about the black truck having a camper
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. in CHUNK_TEXT: Defendant whose involuntary transportation to the Border Patrol station for questioning was deemed 'sufficiently like an arrest' and required probable cause, waived his Miranda rights during an interview with Agent Montemayor, testified that he did not feel free to leave even after being handed his citation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.J. Scott Hacker: United States Magistrate Judge who signed the document on June 4th at Laredo, Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. in CHUNK_TEXT: Defendant whose involuntary transportation to the Border Patrol station for questioning was deemed 'sufficiently like an arrest' and required probable cause
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Officer Reyes: Law enforcement officer who could not recall when Ignacio Rodriguez was informed that a canine would conduct a search, explained procedures regarding stolen vehicles, testified that it was within his rights to impound the vehicle for lack of proof of insurance
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Reyes: Testifying officer, referred to as Officer Reyes
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alberto Ramirez: Director of Transportation, Planning and Development for the Texas Department of Transportation, Laredo Division
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Santiago Hinojosa: Manager with the Hertz rental car company at the Laredo International Airport, testified about the registration of vehicles rented from different locations
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Orona-Sanchez: Individual referenced in a court finding regarding alien smuggling using pickup trucks with camper shells
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the Defendants: Defendants whose driving was considered an aberration from the norm by Agent Trevino, attempted to travel through an indirect route to avoid stationary checkpoints
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino in CHUNK_TEXT: United States Border Patrol Agent stationed at the Freer immigration checkpoint, inspecting vehicles and processing undocumented individuals, followed the black truck for around five minutes noticing it going often off the shoulder, approached a car with five passengers during the incident
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Defendant: Individual being questioned by law enforcement agents, specifically referred to as Ignacio Rodriguez in this context, acknowledged during the hearing that he consented to have his vehicle searched, waived his Miranda rights during an interview with Agent Montemayor
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the undersigned: J. Scott Hacker, United States Magistrate Judge who took judicial notice of the sunset time on February 4, 2013 in Laredo, Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Reymundo Reyes and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR: Individuals involved in a traffic stop where Reymundo Reyes impounded the vehicle due to lack of insurance information and uncertainty about the vehicle's ownership, and Ignacio Rodriguez was the driver who felt he could not leave after being handed his citation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the officer: Law enforcement officer referred to as Officer Reyes
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Santiago Hinojosa in CHUNK_TEXT: Manager with the Hertz rental car company at the Laredo International Airport who testified about the registration of vehicles rented from different locations
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino and Hugo Benavides: Border Patrol agents who testified in the case, with Jorge Luis Trevino providing details about the black truck and camper, and Hugo Benavides not corroborating this testimony
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and Hugo Benavide: Individuals involved in a case where Ignacio Rodriguez was a defendant and Hugo Benavides was a United States Border Patrol Agent who testified about the arrest
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the Border Patrol agents: Jorge Luis Trevino and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Agent Trevino in CHUNK_TEXT: United States Border Patrol Agent who followed the vehicles around 6:00 p.m. and noticed they were driving in tandem
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mills Bennett in CHUNK_TEXT: Involved in the case, mentioned during the cross examination of Agent Trevino, associated with a dirt road near the checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the driver of the vehicle: IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR., a United States citizen who drove the white sedan
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the passengers: Mexican nationals who were in the country illegally
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the trunk passengers: Mexican nationals who admitted to being in the country illegally
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.my partner: Marco Montemayor, partner of Agent Montemayor during the interview with Ignacio Rodriguez
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the agents: Jorge Luis Trevino and Marco Montemayor, agents involved in the investigation and interview of Ignacio Rodriguez
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Dallas-Fort Worth: Location where one of the vehicles was registered
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Corinth: Location where one of the vehicles was registered
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.San Angelo: Location mentioned in a previous case involving alien smuggling
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Arvizu: Defendant in a previous case whose vehicle registration and travel route were considered suspicious
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.two Border Patrol agents: Jorge Luis Trevino and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino and Marco Montemayor: Border Patrol agents involved in the investigation and aware of the load car-scout car pattern
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. or IGNACIO RODRIG: Drivers of the two vehicles that were stopped by Border Patrol agents, with one vehicle being a white sedan and the other being a black truck Dodge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and RICARDO RODRI: Defendants whose vehicles were stopped by law enforcement officers due to suspicion of alien smuggling activities
